name: Castle Mistamere: Bargle's Shadow (Howard Cut)
story: An infamous renegade mage—Bargle—has turned the ruined halls of Castle Mistamere into a nest of schemes. The player, a green but iron-willed fighter, sets out to hunt him through ruin, warren, and warded sanctum.
opening_prompt:
You are a human fighter on your very first adventure—broke as a church mouse, stubborn as an ox. Last night at the Gold Dragon Inn you listened, wide‑eyed, while scarred men traded rumors of Castle Mistamere, Gygar’s fallen keep, now haunted by vermin, shades, and a renegade mage called Bargle.

They spoke of farmsteads bled by tithe‑men sworn to no lord, of caravans that vanish on the north road, and of a purse of coin promised for any proof that Bargle is cast out or dead. A few hard truths stuck--kobolds skulk the outer yard; a locked postern clings to the old gate; and something slimy dozes in a trench near the wall. Light, noise, and patience matter more than a hot blade.

Dawn finds you at the shattered approach. Stone teeth gnaw the sky; vines choke the gatehouse like strangler’s fingers. Your lantern sputters to life. You own little beyond your steel, your wits, and the stubborn courage that dragged you here.

Ahead lies the sagging gate and its watchful yard. To one side, you see a rubble‑choked breach yawning black. Behind you, the road curls back toward the inn and its honest fire. And that trench must be somewhere nearby...

gold_dragon_inn.name: Gold Dragon Inn
gold_dragon_inn.description: Smoke‑black rafters crowd with boar‑hide banners. Tankards thud like war drums; talk runs on iron and blood. A hearth the size of a smithy throws wolf‑light across faces hard as knuckles—sailors, sellswords, stray priests. Rumors coil here like pipe smoke, heavy with gold and treachery.

outer_ruins.name: Outer Ruins
outer_ruins.description: Stone teeth rake the sky where battlements once stood. Brambles clutch the broken gatehouse and creep over toppled lions. Wind prowls the gaps with a jackal’s whine, stirring ash‑gray dust and the spoor of crawling things. The place feels old as a curse—and twice as patient.

town_elder.name: Town Elder
town_elder.description: A stooped official who remembers when Gygar’s banner still flew from the towers. Offers coin and quiet gratitude if Bargle is driven out.

outer_ruins.story: Shattered approaches to Mistamere. Kobold sentries and a carrion crawler force cunning over bravado.

outer_ruins.name: Outer Ruins
outer_ruins.description: Stone teeth gnaw the sky. A rubble mound slumps beside a cracked arch; a slime‑dark trench sulks along the wall. Vultures swing in the high air, patient as priests.

courtyard_gate.name: Courtyard Gate
courtyard_gate.description: A portcullis sags like a broken jaw over a yard gone wild. Weeds spear through flagstones; walls sweat with damp. Small hunters whisper behind the stones. A postern door, iron‑sick and stubborn, watches like a lidded eye.

blocked_exits.postern door: Locked without the brass key; the hinges shriek.
blocked_exits.yard gap: Kobolds watch the open gap; a bold distraction might work.

crawler_trench.name: Crawler Trench
crawler_trench.description: A gutter gouged by siege‑water now slick with alien slime. Shed feelers lie like gray whips; the air tastes of copper and paralysis. The weeds lean as if listening.

first_landing.name: First Landing
first_landing.description: Steps yawn into dark like a giant’s throat. The air cools to cellar‑cold; dust lies unbroken but for the trace of many small feet.

west_hall.name: West Hall
west_hall.description: A corridor split by time and old malice. Tattered pennons hang like flayed skins; mortar crumbles at a touch. The lower stones are scored with claw and spear—once, proud men marched here.

carrion_crawler.name: Carrion Crawler
carrion_crawler.description: Pale feelers taste the air; it waits for the clatter‑minded and the bold.

kobold_sentries.name: Kobold Sentries
kobold_sentries.description: Chattering spear‑rats who love an alarm more than a fight.

contingency_prompts: If the player examines rubble or postern, hint the brass key fits nearby.
Foreshadow the crawler with sensory detail before any clash.
Offer non‑combat methods: distraction, bribe, or wind‑timed sneaking.
Loud attempts raise noise to high; describe kobold stirrings.
contingency_rules: When the player unlocks the postern with the brass key, set entered_first_level to true.
When the player slips the yard gap by stealth or distraction, set entered_first_level to true.
Every risky, loud action sets noise to high; every careful action lowers it to low.
Each player action increments turns_total by 1.

castle_first_level.story: First level exploration—kobold rooms, harpy song, secret seams, and the barred stair downward.

west_hall.name: West Hall
west_hall.description: Faded banners crumble to powder; footprints track dust between rooms. Cold drafts tug like careful fingers toward the east stair.

dining_hall.name: Dining Hall
dining_hall.description: A feasting board sprawls on a broken leg; cups lie like slain kings. Feathers drift in the drafts, and somewhere above, a voice warms its throat with honeyed poison.

statue_room.name: Statue Room
statue_room.description: Gygar’s stone effigy stands battle‑chipped and patient, finger extended toward a hairline seam. Dust of centuries powders your knuckles.

secret_niche.name: Secret Niche
secret_niche.description: A coffin‑long wound in the masonry, scorched and narrow. Wax runs harden like pale stalagmites; a draft whispers of sunless space.

service_passage.name: Service Passage
service_passage.description: Low, mean, and close as a thief’s breath. Grease‑sour air clings to the tongue; the walls shine with the polish of many shoulders.

storeroom.name: Storeroom
storeroom.description: Crates burst their ribs; salt spills like pale sand. Something small scuttles behind a broken lid, leaving a snake of dust.

east_stair.name: East Stair
east_stair.description: Steps plunge into chill like a blade into water. A wedged plank serves as a barring‑spear; the stone bites it like teeth.

blocked_exits.down (barred): The plank must be pried free—or the kobolds can be bargained into removing it.

second_landing.name: Second Landing
second_landing.description: Dark presses here like a mailed fist. Far below, a faint chime rings as if a smith tapped a goblet with a knife.

harpies.name: Harpies
harpies.description: Voices like honey over broken glass.

kobold_foragers.name: Kobold Foragers
kobold_foragers.description: They’d rather trade than die if you speak soft and pay fair.

restless_dead.name: Restless Dead
restless_dead.description: A cupboard rattles; dusty fingers probe the crack.

contingency_prompts: Listening at the Dining Hall foreshadows the harpy song; suggest wax, retreat, or loud interruption.
Present the kobold token as a truce sign that can remove the stair plank.
Remind the player the crowbar can pry the plank.
Use cold drafts and distant chimes to tug toward the stair.
contingency_rules: When the player pries the plank with the crowbar, set stair_unbarred to true.
When the player presents the kobold token at the stair, set stair_unbarred to true.
When the player neutralizes the harpies by any means, set harpies_dealt_with to true.
Each player action increments turns_total by 1.

harpy_crescendo.prompt: The song swells—sweet as summer wine, deadly as a noose. Do you wax your ears, flee, or bellow a war‑cry to break the charm?

castle_second_level.story: Deeper halls—spider lairs, kobold warrens, and the arcane seal that guards the sanctum.

second_landing.name: Second Landing
second_landing.description: Moisture beads on stone. Something skitters just beyond the lantern’s reach.

spider_run.name: Spider Run
spider_run.description: Web‑curtains hang wet and heavy, beading your light into a hundred cold eyes. Every angle of ceiling sharpens for ambush.

kobold_warren.name: Kobold Warren
kobold_warren.description: Low tunnels breathe smoke and stew‑vapor. Bone charms rattle like dice; small voices argue with the pride of cornered jackals.

arcane_antechamber.name: Arcane Antechamber
arcane_antechamber.description: Tiles are etched with circles within triangles, lines bitten deep and blackened by old fires. A night‑colored door hums, waiting for the key that is not a key.

blocked_exits.sealed door: A shallow sigil recess hints it slides, not swings.

sanctum_threshold.name: Sanctum Threshold
sanctum_threshold.description: A short hall where air turns thin as glass. Witchlight breathes beyond a shimmering veil.

bargles_study.name: Bargle’s Study
bargles_study.description: Books brood in ranks; bottled shadows twitch like trapped eels. Sealed letters speckle a desk scarred by quick tempers.

giant_spiders.name: Giant Spiders
giant_spiders.description: They prefer still prey; smoke and fire unsettle them.

kobold_matriarch.name: Kobold Matriarch
kobold_matriarch.description: She keeps a brittle peace if shown respect; bluster offends.

contingency_prompts: Remind the player the Gygar sigil fits the recess.
If lacking the sigil, offer a bargain with the Matriarch or an improvised mechanism using webbing and picks.
If the study is empty, scatter fresh clues: warm ink, half‑drunk cup, veil‑ward footprints.
contingency_rules: When the player fits the Gygar sigil or reveals hidden latches with help or tools, set sanctum_path_revealed to true.
Each player action increments turns_total by 1.

kobold_parley.prompt: The Matriarch clicks her teeth and offers terms: respect the warrens, and she'll whisper a sanctum secret—for a price.

bargle_encounter.story: The warded sanctum—Bargle’s tricks, taunts, and exits. Endgame by cornering, banishing, or letting him slip the noose.

bargles_study.name: Bargle’s Study
bargles_study.description: Shelves whisper as pages turn themselves. A mirror glows like a stormy eye.

mirror_gallery.name: Mirror Gallery
mirror_gallery.description: Three high mirrors brood beneath a ceiling veined with soot—one smoky, one clear, one cracked. Each a promise; each a lie.

escape_catwalk.name: Escape Catwalk
escape_catwalk.description: A narrow lattice spans a throat of black machinery and cold light. Far ahead a dark cloak snaps around a turning—flight made arrogant.

ward_circle.name: Ward Circle
ward_circle.description: Chalk triangles and guttering candles hem a circle that will not be crossed lightly. Within a bell‑jar, a moth of living night beats wings that dim the room.

decoy_chamber.name: Decoy Chamber
decoy_chamber.description: Alchemical citrus masks a clever lie: Bargle slumped over a desk that was never there. Dust swirls wrong—like a tale with a false ending.

bargle.name: Bargle
bargle.description: A velvet voice and quick hands; he loves escape more than victory.

contingency_prompts: Bargle taunts first; offer routes to corner, bargain, or banish.
Using the shadow moth should make wards flicker like wet chalk.
contingency_rules: When the player disrupts the ring and corners Bargle on the catwalk, set bargle_cornered to true.
When the player brandishes letters and drives a pact of exile, set bargle_exiled to true.
When the player dithers among mirrors too long, set bargle_escaped to true.
When the player shatters the ward and forces him through the cracked mirror, set bargle_exiled to true.
Each player action increments turns_total by 1.

mirror_misdirection.prompt: The clear mirror brightens with a hunter's moon; the smoky one coughs a shadow. Which peril do you choose?

contingency_prompts: Use a lean, hard‑edged sword‑and‑sorcery voice. Keep responses vivid but actionable.
Offer non‑combat solutions—distraction, negotiation, cunning use of gear.
Track light and noise; warn when risk builds.
If the player stalls, remind them of discovered exits, items, or deals on the table.
Address the player as a first‑time human fighter: green, broke, brave.
contingency_rules: Scene transitions must include fallback checks: if the required item or state is already true, progression occurs when the player attempts the relevant exit.
If the player brute‑forces loudly and often, nearby factions converge and drive them back to the Gold Dragon Inn (light and noise reset).
game_end_prompt: The torches gutter and the tale is told. Weigh the fighter's courage, cunning, and mercy. Did they unmask tricks, spare foes, or trade steel for sly words? Did Bargle fall, flee, or bow to exile? Count trophies, secrets pried from shadow, and the hush they earn in the inn. Give them a toast with iron in it.
